course.subject: MECH
course.name: Laboratory
course.description: Introductory laboratory course to provide training in experimental techniques and laboratory procedures, data acquisition, analysis and presentation.

reviews.author: Jacky 01
reviews.title: Worst Mech course ever
reviews.comment_content:
This course will teach you how to collect data, calculate error etc. It combines contents from other course, include: Mech 2210, Mech 2410, Mech 3610, Elec 1010, Mech 3300 etc. But due to the bad teaching, we don't understand anything of how the topic can be related to application. And as the content is so special, it is quite hard to search from the internet for self study. And mech major in other University in Hong Kong don't even have similar course. So it is quite hard to understand the content. And it is also quite useless for us.

We also have lab reports. In regular semester, there are totally 10 labs but only 4 of them are required to write a report. The reports are individual. Also, each lab are required to write a lab notebook. But for our semester, we reduce the lab number to 6 but still need to write 4 lab reports.
reviews.comment_teaching: Worst lecture. The tutor do not give any examples for the contents or any explanation. Sometimes he teach the content required for the homework after the homework is due. Most of us don't know how to do the homework so the mean for this course is much lower compare to other course's homework. Although we have tutorial section, it is a Q and A section which they don't teach anything. The knowledge for finishing the homework and online practice will not be explained. And they won't release the solution for the online practice. The solution for homework is also very brief. You cannot understand the lecture notes as it is mostly pictures. It lacks detail explanation which makes it very hard to understand. I need to use last years lecture notes which was done by another professor. Even if you ask him during the "tutorial", he will only explain the theory, not the detailed solution. So you can't understand it. And for the summer lab report, the deadline is 12th Aug, but the professor said we should submit at least 1 report before 5th Aug so that the grader can gave back feedback in order to correct and improve other lab reports. But after we submit it before 5th Aug, there are still no reply after the submission deadline! So it is useless.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online practice 5%
Lab notebook 5%
Lab performance 5%
Report content 10%
Report organization and format 10%
Homework 10%
Mid-term 15%
Final exam 30%

For the homework, you need to beware of the sig fig of your final answer as it will deduct marks. However, for the model answer of the homework they upload, they don't care about the sig fig and shows the wrong sig fig any way.

For mid-term and exam, there are mc questions and long questions.There are 3 long questions and 20 mc question in both exams.

For the summer lab, we change the lab to online due to the second wave of the Covid-19 pandemic. As the lab report is individual, they send us different data for each student, which means one person will have one unique data. However, as some group have their lab section earlier, those group can go back to school and finish the lab. This is quite unfair because those people can use group data, which can reduce the workload for data processing a lot. But what makes it worse is the lab notebook. Those earlier lab section group can do one lab notebook per group, but we need to do one lab notebook per student! And for lab 9, 10, as we don't need to have lab report for those 2 lab, the earlier lab section can just write a lab notebook by group which is very easy to get full marks. However, for us we change it to online quiz, which is limited for 10mins for each test and the quiz is very difficult! Those quiz require you to have deeper understanding to the lab which writing the lab notebook doesn't require. The quiz involve a lot of calculation which you need to find it in the lab video. However, they do not show the data in the video very clearly. You will be easily miss the data and lose marks for the quiz. The mean for the 2 quiz are 1.9/5 and 1/2! Most of us cannot get full marks. So I think the grading arrangement is very bad and unfair to us.

The marking for the lab report seems to be weird as well. They don't care about the content, but they will deduct marks of your format like not having a page number or reference. However, the example lab report they give also don't have page number. They deduct 2 marks for the page number, and 10 marks for the reference. This is very unreasonable as the FFT part also takes 10 marks, but FFT's content is as much as a individual report which takes more than 10 pages. The marking standard is very unclear. You need to follow every format from Lang4034 strictly. Even though you didn't search any information for the report, you still need to have reference of your lecture notes.
reviews.comment_workload: We postpone our lab to the summer due to the pandemic. The lab suppose to be the heaviest workload. We have total 6 labs in this summer, with only the first 4 labs are required to have report. But we need to write lab notebook for all 6 reports. However, the instruction for the report are not clear, you need to search everything by yourself. And as the teaching is so bad that the lecture content is hard to understand, writing the lab report are quite difficult. Especially for lab 1, I think it is the most difficult lab report. A lot of the content for lab 1 are required to search by yourself. And you need to do Matlab for lab 1 which very few of people knows how to do! The FFT is just one part of lab 1, but it is as long as a individual report. We have about a month for the 4 report during summer, and I could say the time is just about enough. The individual lab report are quite time consuming. It can easily takes 1 week to finish just 1 report. So remember to do it early. We have 3 homework and 5 online practice. The online practice and homework is very difficult as they don't explain much. Online practice should give you score as you has done it.

reviews.author: 4EverSD
reviews.title: Trash course ever
reviews.comment_content: This course intentionally teaches the skills and related  knowledges in experiment, but there are lack of materials and example to let you know how the concepts or techniques are. And the solutions of online practices,assignments, midterm are short. It is hard to let you learn well.
reviews.comment_teaching: He seems to try hard for letting you have good understanding on the concepts but yet the effectiveness is very low. Maybe he makes a wrong way to do that.
reviews.comment_workload: The workloads are relatively high, including online practices, assignments, Labs, midterm and final exam. As a laboratory based, it is unreasonable to include midterm and exam.

reviews.author: GK
reviews.title: Welcome to MECH, typical chur完好grade的一科
reviews.comment_content:
As named in the title, laboratories. You will be learning the skill of designing experiments, analyzing experiments and reporting experiment. There are a list of 10 experiments you have to perform in this course. You have to do all of the experiments and write full report about them. In my semester, the first 5 are based on a two person group. You can choose to have both working for each report or take turns on doing it individually. The other 5 are done in groups of 5 where each person do one report on one of the 5 experiments.
[Edit] The course content are quite useful especially when I am having an internship at a research based company. The content could be said to be the most related to research direction.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Qiu is a very nice professor. He explain things very in detail with examples. Furthermore, he could understand Cantonese so you could ask him easily after class. He is willing to answer any question. I would say, among all the other MECH courses, this one is one of the worth-attending lessons on my list.
reviews.comment_grading:
Despite all the super long lab reports, the percentage they occupy is actually not a lot. At the same time, the scores of the report are all very high (9/10 for nearly everyone). Other percentage like homework and lab attendance are all everyone full marks. As a result, the grade basically depends on the not-so-highly-percentaged exams. Since they are quite easy, getting a good mark is important.
Finally got an A, quite good I think.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is huge especially during the first half of the semester. You have to submit a full report every week, for choosing the cooperated way. A full report is really tough to finish so add oil. Assignments are not that tough anyway. After churing the first half semester, it will be a low workload course until exam, yet since material are not much, the studying is not very chur afterall.

reviews.author: Zavy
reviews.comment_content:
This course is focused purely on experimentation and analysis. In the first few weeks, the course covers fundamental mathematical analysis tools (mainly statistics) and introduces Fast Fourier Transform for signal analysis. Other than that, there are 8 total experiments covering a wide variety of previously learned engineering principles.
Exp 1: Data Acquisition and Data Analysis
Exp 2: Free & Forced Vibrations
Exp 3: Strain Measurement and Stress Concentration
Exp 4: Flow through a Venturi Meter
Exp 5: Boundary Layer
Exp 6: Convective Heat Transfer
Exp 7: Refrigeration and Air Conditioning
Exp 8: Fracture Toughness

Experiments are done as a group (form your won group at the start of the sem, same group for all experiments), some are fairly quick ( you can leave early). Some experiments can even run over the allotted time slot ( Exp 5&6 ).

Students are only required to write Lab reports on 4 of the 8 experiments. Everyone wrote a report on Experiments 1 and 2. The other 2 reports were on Experiments 3-8, which were assigned such that members of a group were not writing the same report.

The Lab Manual is a crucial tool for this course, be sure not to lose it. You will use it for all experiments, homework and even preparing for the midterm.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is decent. He knows his stuff and is willing to explain further when prompted. He is a pretty chill guy and doesn't mind if you attend the lectures or tutorials, all he asks is not to disturb the class if you are present.

The TAs are very helpful, you can go to them with any inquiries and they will help you out. They respond fairly quickly over email as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading of this course is fairly straightforward.
It follows an absolute grading system as it is difficult to grade on a curve when individual lab reports do not differ by much.

8 Experiments (32%) ( Must attend all Labs, late penalties as well)
- Lab Notebook 16%
- Lab Performance 16%

4 Reports (28%)
- Technical Content 12%
- Language % Writing 16%

3 Homeworks (15%)

Midterm Exam (25%)
- MCs and Calcualtion Problems

Getting an 85% overall should get you an A-
reviews.comment_workload:
This is an easy course but takes a lot of effort.

I'd recommend starting each lab report the day you finish the experiment.

Midterm was not too difficult, as long as you are comfortable doing statistics and algebra you should be fine. As for content, you can memorize it, it's not a lot.

reviews.author: SpriteUp
reviews.comment_content:
the course content is basic knowledge for mech students, it is easy and the teaching material is just for you to have a brief knowledge about the lab, so the teaching of those materials was finished in the middle of the semester.
the experiment can really help students to have a better understanding of the content if the student really analysis the lab result, but the problem is those TAs give marks of lab report based on the format is correct but not the content is correct, so if your format is correct, all question was answered, you will get full mark no matter the answer is correct or not. it is not fair to those
who really analysis the result and do reserach on it. so I give the content a C.
reviews.comment_teaching: the prof. is actually teach quite clear, the TA is helpful during the lab. feel free to ask through email or f2f, it is very helpful for understanding the report requirement and the content. But the TA marking guideline is weird, which is mentioned in the content part.
reviews.comment_grading:
the course content is easy so the midterm is easy, I just study one morning and got 42/45 in the MC part and 45/55 in the LQ part. as I mentioned in content part, the marking guideline is stupid so I got all 100 as other students who just followed the people's method in the source which is clearly not making any sense. the virtual lab asmt and regular asmt is easy so full mark as well. the quiz don't care you are correct or not, once you submit, you will get full mark.
overall an A+, in grading perspective, the grade is good
reviews.comment_workload:
Very heavy workload,
4 virtual lab asmt, 3 regular asmt, 6 lab report and 5 quiz.
the lab is easy as you follow the TA instruction
but each report needs half a day's work to be done.
the report needs to be submitted two weeks after the lab. well management of time can help a lot.

reviews.author: bbmadevipalive
reviews.title: Kind and humorous professor...useful and practical lab course
reviews.comment_content:
10 labs
5 labs in a group of 2
5 labs in a group of 4 to 6
The lab contents are related to various aspects of mech eg
stress and strain
thermodynamics
fluid mechanics
refrigeration cycle
heat transfer and so on.
This course helped to relate the theoretical knowledge we learnt to labwork
Also, it addressed the difference between theories and reality.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Qiu is humorous and his teaching provides directions to stimulate students' thinking instead of giving the correct answers right away. He is also passionate and likes to chat with students.
reviews.comment_grading:
The marks of lab reports and similar among students...usually around 90/100.
I got average marks for the reports.
The midterm was easy and many guys got 90 something.
I got 84/100 which was clearly below mean.
Not sure about the marks of homework and final exam.
Ended up with a B+
reviews.comment_workload:
2 pieces of homework
a number of online quizzes on the blended learning platform
you gain the marks for the quizzes regardless of the number of questions you answered right as long as you have submitted them
I find it an encouraging approach without placing too much burden on students
one midterm and one final exam
10 labs and 4 full lab reports

reviews.author: CKL
reviews.comment_content:
This course teaches you some theories related to experiments and measurements of different engineering quantities. You can gain some sense about that through 10 labs.

Lecture contents:
-Basic concepts and terms
-Design of experiments
-Data acquisition
-Analysis of experimental data
-Temperature measurements
-Motion and vibration measurements
-Flow measurements
-Stress and strain
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching of the professor is good in lectures. By contrast, he does not explain clearly and in details in the online videos, maybe he is uncomfortable with that.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online quizzes: 5%
10 experiments: 20%
4 reports: 20%
2 homework: 10%
Midterm exam: 15%
Final exam: 30%

My scores:
Reports: 91, 93, 97, 96 out of 100
Homework: 97, 100 out of 100
Midterm exam: 97 out of 100
Final exam: not released
Grade: A+

The professor has not released the statistics of any exams. As I know, most of the students get higher than 80 marks in midterm as it is quite easy. The final exam is also easy, although harder when compared with the midterm. In the homework and lab reports, most of the students get more than 90 marks due to lenient grading of TAs. If you want to get an A-range, you need to have nearly perfect score in every assignment and exam.
reviews.comment_workload: The course has an imbalance workload throughout the semester. The first half of the semester is tough but the second half is comfortable. All lectures and tutorials will be finished after the first half, so you only have to deal with labs in the second half. You have to submit 3 reports in the first half and 1 report in the second half.

reviews.author: Alex_3766
reviews.title: Funny, Interesting Prof. Chur but Good Grade
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting content. Basically merges all the important contents you have learnt from year 2 courses into one course.
Sampling Theory
Natural Frequency
Thermocouple
Stress and Strain
Boundary Layer
Refrigerant Cycle
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching is good in the real lectures, but I don't know the situation in blended learning leacture videos nowadays.
Prof. Qiu is really interactive, talk about some interesting cases that you might encounter in your career.
Lab TA are nice too. They would help and lead you to the correct direction.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good if you are hardworking.
I got an "A" provided that I attend every lessons, got full marks in mid term and understand about 95% of the materials.
Add oil anyways, you cannot escape from this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite huge indeed. The lab reports are not kidding. Its like never ending once you started your lab until week 13. Rmb to find a reliable team mate, and do not freeride.
Although there are not much lectures that Prof. Qiu could finish all the materials in the middle of the semester, the workload is great due to the lab reports.

reviews.author: MS01
reviews.title: Easy course
reviews.comment_content: The content was followed by the lab manual the professor designed. It is not much in content and he managed to finish the content in 6-7 weeks. Therefore, we didn't have class in the last 3-4 weeks. We only had a final review session before the exam.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Blended learning style was used in this semester. You had to watch the online videos and finished some online quizzes before coming to the lecture.

I don't mind to study a course in a blended learning mode, but it is better to find a TA with a better English proficiency that responsible for online videos. When I watched the online video at the first time, his English accent was surprised me a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quiz                            5%
Laboratory notebook            10%
Laboratory performance       10%
Lab Reports                          20%
Homework                            10%
Midterm Exam                      15%
Final Exam                            30%
--------------------------------------------
Finally got an A-, I think it is quite good for me.

I did not spend much time on this course. I only used 1 - 2 hours for copy and paste in my lab report.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is manageable I think, better than MECH2907 already.

Online Videos and Quizzes:
No need to watch the videos, just directly take the quizzes, no matter your answer is correct or not, you can get a full mark. Remember to complete them on time!

Lab-work:
Find a partner that he/she is responsible and easy-going. If you can cooperate well with each other, you could finish the experiment earlier and leave.

Lab Report:
If you have source, just paraphrase it and use your own data in the result part. The theory and procedure part can just copy from the lab manual.

Midterm and Final Exam:
As both of them are open-book exams, PLEASE print all the previous years' homework answers. Everyone does it. Therefore the mean is really high.

reviews.author: Jace
reviews.comment_content: Basically not much content just doing the lab and the report are the most important part.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is ok, not too bad. But his online video is not good at all, just read the book, it should be better.
reviews.comment_grading: If your spent a lot of the time it should be fine for the report part. However, each report will take you more than 5 hours.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say this is a heavy work load class, but for mech student you need to take it, it is unavoidable. So good luck.

reviews.author: Nasty
reviews.title: Boring Course, Easy Grade
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course was much less than other courses. However, it wasn't very interesting. The prof finished the content in 6 weeks and then for the next 6 weeks we didn't have class. We just had a review session before the final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching was quite poor. Students went to class only to get the attendance bonus.
Most lab TAs were good. However, they were quite strict about punctuality and I got penalised for being late.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was more lenient than other course. I felt the midterm exam was too easy for me. However, the final was tougher.
The only problem in grading was the erratic grading of lab reports by TAs. In the second half of the semester, they were crazily lenient and gave many students 9 or 10 for language although their language was below-par.
reviews.comment_workload:
I felt the workload was manageable because I didn't have to study much for it. I prefer writing lab reports over studying crazily.
The midterm and the final were both open-book exams, so they were very application based.
Lab-work was easy because my partner and I worked well together.
